dialogueLines.Text: Hey, /Player/. Didn't think you would be back so soon. Thaddeus is probably at his office still.
dialogueLines.Speaker: MAX

dialogueLines.Text: Good evening, /Player/. I think Thaddeus is still at the center of town.
dialogueLines.Speaker: ALEX

dialogueLines.Text: Good to have you back, /Player/! Charlie's going to start pestering you with requests for stories, now that you're returned. It's late, but Thaddeus should still be in his office working.
dialogueLines.Speaker: BENNY

dialogueLines.Text: Hi, /Player/! How were the forests?
dialogueLines.Speaker: CHARLIE

dialogueLines.Text: Good evening, /Player/. Glad to see you're back. Tommy's disappeared somewhere, but Thaddeus is in the center of town, still.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, /Player/. It's so dark outside.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: Ah, /Player/, good to see you. I heard that you were back in town from your expedition early, and am excited to hear about what you discovered.
dialogueLines.Speaker: THADDEUS

dialogueLines.Text: Good to see you, too, Mayor Thaddeus.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: And your partner? Have they come back to town as well?
dialogueLines.Speaker: THADDEUS

dialogueLines.Text: That's what I wanted to talk about. We ran into some, uh, issues around the outskirts.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: I saw the towers had been lit.
dialogueLines.Speaker: THADDEUS

dialogueLines.Text: Yes. The storm that we were scouting turned out worse than either of us expected.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: And the other lookout?
dialogueLines.Speaker: THADDEUS

dialogueLines.Text: They didn't survive, Thaddeus. I'm not sure what happened, but the storm did it. Thunder and lightning and then their whole station cut out.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: We still should have a few days at the pace the storm's been moving.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Thank you. I'm still wrapped up here for a couple of hours, so I would appreciate your telling the other townspeople of what's going on. There's been some talk at the towers being lit, but they need to know the severity.
dialogueLines.Speaker: THADDEUS

dialogueLines.Text: And it'll be good since you've only been in town for a few weeks. A few folks might have some things for you to help them with, too--the other lookouts would help around town when they weren't scouting.
dialogueLines.Speaker: THADDEUS

dialogueLines.Text: But these people have know each other a long time, and they've built a community on trust. So show them you care, and they'll help you out however they can.
dialogueLines.Speaker: THADDEUS

dialogueLines.Text: When you're done, come back to me. I'll start thinking about how we'll get through this storm, and I'll have need of you. Good evening, /Player/.
dialogueLines.Speaker: THADDEUS

dialogueLines.Text: Good evening, Mayor.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, /Player/. How are you doing?
dialogueLines.Speaker: MAX

dialogueLines.Text: I'm good, Max. Just wanted to let you know that there's a pretty big storm headed this way. Nothing to be concerned about yet, Thaddeus just wanted everyone to have a heads-up.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: I figured something was off when the towers lit up. Haven't seen that in a few years.
dialogueLines.Speaker: MAX

dialogueLines.Text: So it's a storm you say? Well, if you find yourself afield soon, it might help us to have more data. There's a grid of sensors that have been dead for a few years outside town, but it shouldn't take much to get them running.
dialogueLines.Speaker: MAX

dialogueLines.Text: I'll look into it, then.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Thanks. Again, you should just need a spark to get them going. Have a good night.
dialogueLines.Speaker: MAX

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, Tyler. How's it going?
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: I'm fine. Thanks for stopping by to say hello, but I'm looking for Tommy.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: This won't take long, but Thaddeus wanted me to let you know that there's a storm heading toward town. It's why we lit the towers.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Oh, I didn't notice. Must've been just a few hours ago.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: Yeah. Nothing to worry about for now, but just be aware.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Okay. Thank you. Well, if you're going around town, do you think that you could help look for Tommy? It's been a couple hours and I have no clue where they are.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: I'll keep an eye out and tell them to head home.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Thank you, /Player/. Have a good evening.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: Good to see you again. Have you heard from Tommy yet?
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, Tyler. How's it going?
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: I'm fine. Thanks for stopping by to say hello, but I'm looking for Tommy.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: Oh! I saw him playing earlier by Town Hall. He asked me to look for a stuffed animal for him.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Oh, great, okay. Can you tell him that they should come home before the sun sets?
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: Yeah, of course.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Thank you so much. Though I'm assuming you didn't stop by to hear me ask about Tommy's whereabouts?
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: Yeah, Thaddeus wanted me to stop by and let you know that there's a storm heading toward town. It's why we lit the towers.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Oh, I didn't notice. It must've happened when I was looking for Tommy.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: Yeah. Nothing to worry about for now, but just be aware.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Okay, thanks for letting me know. Have a good evening!
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, Tyler. Wanted to check in and see if Tommy's returned yet.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Yeah, they arrived a few minutes ago. Thank you so much.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: Hi, /Player/!
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: Good to see that you're home safe, Tommy. Have a great night.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, /Player/!
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, Tommy! What are you doing out here by yourself?
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: I lost my stuffed rabbit and can't find it.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: Sorry, kid. Is it around here somewhere?
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: I think so. Do you think you could help?
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: I can keep an eye out for it.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Thank you! Have a good night.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: Good to see you, too, Tommy.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, /Player/!
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, Tommy! You know that Tyler's looking for you. What are you doing out here by yourself?
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: I lost my stuffed rabbit and can't find it.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: Sorry, kid. But you really should get going home. It's getting late.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: I don't want to go home without my rabbit.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: Is it around here somewhere?
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: I think so. Do you think you could help?
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: I can keep an eye out for it.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Thank you! Have a good night.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: Good to see you, too, Tommy.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, /Player/! Have you found my rabbit yet?
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, Tommy! Guess what I found!
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: My rabbit! Thank you so much!
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: Of course, kid.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Now that you've found the rabbit, will you come home? Remember, Tyler's been looking for you all afternoon.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Okay. I'll head there.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: Thanks, Tommy. You're a good kid. Get home safe.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, /Player/! You're back early.
dialogueLines.Speaker: CHARLIE

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, Charlie. How're you doing?
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: I'm good! Max has been teaching me and Charlie a lot of things.
dialogueLines.Speaker: CHARLIE

dialogueLines.Text: That's great. Well, I don't know if you've heard already, but there's a storm that should hit in a few days, so you two should be careful playing outside, alright?
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Okay, we will. But I wish that I could go see it up close like you. It seems so cool! And I could learn so many things from it, like how lightning works, or how rain clouds develop.
dialogueLines.Speaker: CHARLIE

dialogueLines.Text: That would be fun, Charlie, but it's not safe. You can still learn all that from Max, indoors.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: I know. But if you go out there again, could you catch lightning for me?
dialogueLines.Speaker: CHARLIE

dialogueLines.Text: What?
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Yeah! I have this bottle-device that Tommy and I made awhile ago. You just need to set it near something that attracts lightning and -- zap! -- it'll catch it.
dialogueLines.Speaker: CHARLIE

dialogueLines.Text: Interesting. Well, I'll see what I can do next time I'm in the field.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Thank you so much! This is going to be so cool!
dialogueLines.Speaker: CHARLIE

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, /Player/. Thanks again for the heads up about the storm, and let me know how activating the detectors goes. Can't wait to see their data.
dialogueLines.Speaker: MAX

dialogueLines.Text: Hey, /Player/. Thanks for letting me know. You can never prepare enough, you know? Whatever happens, I'm gonna come through it on my feet. Just got to get preparing in the meantime.
dialogueLines.Speaker: ALEX

dialogueLines.Text: Thanks for stopping by, /Player/. I'm not too worried about this storm, though. We've seen worse. I'll try to keep Charlie inside. They're really intrigued by the entire situation, if you can imagine it.
dialogueLines.Speaker: BENNY

dialogueLines.Text: Hi! I can't wait to see more of the storm. Through my window, though. And I can't wait to see my lightning-in-a-bottle!
dialogueLines.Speaker: CHARLIE

dialogueLines.Text: Thanks for finding Tommy, again. And for letting us know about the storm.
dialogueLines.Speaker: TYLER

dialogueLines.Text: Hi, /Player/! Thank you for finding my rabbit. See you later!
dialogueLines.Speaker: TOMMY

dialogueLines.Text: Good to see you back, /Player/. I've taken it that you've made the rounds since you've come back. Well, to business then. Since the incident at the Lookout Tower was caused by the storm, we think that we would be best served by your investigating it.
dialogueLines.Speaker: THADDEUS

dialogueLines.Text: Is there anything specific I should be looking for?
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: We're not entirely sure. But as long as you can get to the Tower and see if there's anything informative about the area, that will be enough.
dialogueLines.Speaker: THADDEUS

dialogueLines.Text: I'll set off at once, then.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: Great. But if there are things you need to do for people in town, you should finish those up. I'm not sure how long you'll be gone, and people can be impatient.
dialogueLines.Speaker: THADDEUS

dialogueLines.Text: Noted.
dialogueLines.Speaker: PLAYER

dialogueLines.Text: The path back to the Tower is on the far east of town. Hopefully you'll be able to find answers there.
dialogueLines.Speaker: THADDEUS
